Generate an alert of the following sentence knowing that the data in parenthesis is an Named-entity tag
and that the sentiment of the sentece is SA = positive. You can use different alert sentences as long as 
you mention something related to the entity type of the subject and something related with the SA of
the phrase.

### SENTENCE
Local (B-PERSON) library (I-PERSON) hosts (B-GPE) weekend (B-GPE) book (B-GPE) fair (B-GPE) for (B-GPE) community (B-GPE) members (B-GPE)

### EXAMPLE
An example of an alert is for the inputs: â€œMusk (B-PERSON) accused of giving Nazi (B-ORG) salute during Trump (B-PERSON) inauguration (B-EVENT) celebrations (I-EVENT)" SA = negative
output: " REPUTATION RISK: Musk mentioned NEGATIVELY"

Here is a possible alert for the given sentence:

**COMMUNITY EVENT ALERT**: Local library hosts a weekend book fair, receiving POSITIVE attention from community members!

This alert mentions something related to the entity type of the subject (library and community members, which are related to GPE/PERSON entities) and also highlights the positive sentiment (SA = positive) of the sentence. 

Alternatively, here is another possible alert:

**POSITIVE VIBES IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD**: A local library (a key community hub) is hosting a weekend book fair, generating a POSITIVE buzz among community members!

This alert also conveys the positive sentiment and highlights the importance of the library as a community hub.
